comments:
CDT 200405170943
Eclipse 200405140800
QE_TestCase_P2_SE69

I have marked this as a major because the outcome is different from what is
indicated in the user documentation.

---

The help documentation indicates the use of an asterik inside the brackets of a
function or method pattern is invalid because the '*' character inside brackets
denotes a pointer.

e.g.  foo(*) is an invalid search pattern

But the documentation states that CDT will handle this case gracefully by
ignoring the brackets and doing a search for any function foo.

Currently, an ugly error message is presented indicating that something went
wrong and the following is dumped to the .log file:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 May 21, 2004 14:53:25.265
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Search for All Occurrences "*(*)"".
!STACK 0
java.lang.ClassCastException
	at
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.search.matching.CSearchPattern.scanForParameters(CSearchPattern.java:503)
	at
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.search.matching.CSearchPattern.createMethodPattern(CSearchPattern.java:312)
	at
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.search.matching.CSearchPattern.createMethodPattern(CSearchPattern.java:287)
	at
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.search.matching.CSearchPattern.createPattern(CSearchPattern.java:126)
	at
org.eclipse.cdt.core.search.SearchEngine.createSearchPattern(SearchEngine.java:147)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.search.CSearchQuery.run(CSearchQuery.java:151)
	at
org.eclipse.search2.internal.ui.InternalSearchUI$InternalSearchJob.run(InternalSearchUI.java:87)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

fixed with commit on 2004-05-21

searching with bad parameter list should result in the same as no parameter list

"foo(*)" == "foo"

This bug has been verified on Eclipse build 20040603 and CDT build 
200406030301, and it passes.

Pixy.
